alert.note: Alert for Lee (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 24 at 12:25PM CDT until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Quad Cities IA IL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Iowa...Illinois... Missouri... Mississippi River at Keokuk LD19 affecting Lee, Hancock and Clark Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Keokuk LD19. * WHEN...From Friday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Water affects low lying buildings in rural areas. Water affects the railroad tracks in Alexandria. At 18.4 feet, U.S. Highway 61 closes at the bridge over the Des Moines River between Alexandria and Keokuk. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:10 PM CDT Monday the stage was 13.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late Friday morning and continue rising to 17.7 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued late tonight.
